abstract: Reports by National Women's Law Center and Kaiser Family Foundation find health insurance companies often flout requirement of Affordable Care Act that they cover all approved methods of birth control for women without co-payments or other charges.
lead_paragraph: Two reports say that failure to follow provisions of the Affordable Care Act had left some women with significant cost barriers to birth control.

headline.main: Insurers Flout Rule Covering Birth Control, Studies Find
headline.print_headline: Insurers Flout Rule Covering Birth Control, Studies Find

snippet: Two reports say that failure to follow provisions of the Affordable Care Act had left some women with significant cost barriers to birth control.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
